title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 04 February 2014 - XWiki
content:
<ansuz> has joined #xwiki

10:49 <mflorea1> has joined #xwiki  
10:51 <mflorea> has quit  
11:05 <mflorea1> has quit  
11:15 <gdelhumeau> can I commit on master?  
11:15 <gdelhumeau> only 5.4.x is frozen, no?  
11:17 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
11:26 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
11:28 <msmeria> has quit  
11:40 <kaisen> Hello, is there someone you can help me on two points of conception of a new XWiki instance?  
11:40 <kaisen> One is related to the "hardware" to get a fast system running  
11:40 <kaisen> the other one is on nameing  
11:40 <kaisen> What should be on fast SAS Disks beside the Database?  
11:40 <kaisen> The Tomcat?  
11:45 <Sidali\_> has joined #xwiki  
11:47 <Sidali> has quit  
11:47 <Sidali\_> is now known as <Sidali>  
11:51 <kaisen> Maybe the solr and lucene search folder?  
11:52 <ClemensR> I guess the disc speed for the tomcat is not very important, as it is only needed on startup  
11:53 <ClemensR> the server should just have enough ram and a good cache size imo  
11:54 <ClemensR> I have to admit that I did not have trouble with disk speed so far  
12:20 <autoditac> has quit  
12:27 <kaisen> So what is a good ram size and a fitting cache size? 8GB? 16GB?  
12:27 <kaisen> Whould be ~120 Users  
12:27 <kaisen> As it will be the start page of each users I want to have it as fast as possible  
12:29 <ClemensR> 8 GB should be completely sufficient - actually with more than 4GB ram the JVM is even getting slower instead of faster  
12:29 <ClemensR> no worries about 120 Users  
12:29 <kaisen> My main problem is the AS on the main page as it is sometimes really slow  
12:30 <kaisen> 20-30sec to load  
12:31 <ClemensR> that means something is completely odd  
12:32 <ClemensR> 20-30 sec is ok for the very first request, because XWiki is initializing  
12:33 <ClemensR> ah, wait, the AS ...  well, maybe there are indexes in the DB missing? Aside of that the As is known not to be blazing fast, but as it is loaded via ajax, this should not affect the rest of the page  
13:08 <kaisen> How can I check if a indexes is missing. I just create them once. But if some users edit pages several times the AS gets slower and slower. As soon I remove the AS from Dashboard it runs fast  
13:09 <kaisen> On normal days when the AS only shows page small page edits the page loads between 1-5sec  
13:11 <kaisen> On normal days when the AS only shows updates from small page edits like 1-2 edits per page, the dashboard loads in 1-5 sec. But if a users edits a page 10+ times then the Dashboard takes over 10sec to load  
13:16 <ClemensR> then DB index might not really help, seems some logic inside the activity steam itself takes lots of time. I think this is a known issue  
13:21 <Danilo> has joined #xwiki  
13:23 <Danilo> Hello People, I would like a opinion. Do you think that is possible to track all activity in XWiki per user, for example, I will have various documents attached in a page and we want to track who viewed and who download these archives... I was wondering if is it possible to make an aplication that give this kind of control in a wiki.  
13:30 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
13:30 <polx> has quit  
13:39 <ClemensR> I think the statistics module (if enabled) collect data like that. not sure about the downloads, however  
13:41 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
13:42 <Inge-> What about web server http logs?  
13:42 <Inge-> hm.. no user info I guess  
13:43 <msmeria1> gdelhumeau: hello  
13:44 <Danilo> I am using Piwik to analyze the infos however I just can get the IP of the user not the user in wiki  
13:47 <gdelhumeau> msmeria1: hello  
13:47 <msmeria1> gdelhumeau: regarding XWIKI-9904, if I can successfully create a subwiki from a template and add some members at creation, does that mean it's fixed ?  
13:48 <gdelhumeau> msmeria1: yes  
13:48 <gdelhumeau> msmeria1: you will check it by addign at least 3 members and control they are there after the creation  
13:48 <msmeria1> gdelhumeau: ok. thanks!  
13:49 <gdelhumeau> msmeria1: thx you for testing!  
13:49 <msmeria1> gdelhumeau: np. I added 4 members and they're all added to the subwiki  
13:50 <gdelhumeau> so it's good :)  
13:57 <ClemensR> Danilo: Piwik has some "extra variables"; if you use on of these extra variables as the user name that should work. You will have to adapt the piwik code  used in the xwiki pages to achieve that  
14:00 <Danilo> Great Clemens I will research to see how to make it possible,  
14:00 <Danilo> thank you  
14:03 <ClemensR> piwik  actually calls it "custom variables":  http://piwik.org/docs/custom-variables/  
14:20 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
14:28 <GuillaumeF> has joined #xwiki  
14:44 <Danilo> has quit  
14:45 <ekarlso-> has quit  
14:45 <ekarlso> has joined #xwiki  
15:08 <msmeria1> tmortagne: XWIKI-9993 is reproduced evend with WikiStream enabled for import  
15:08 <msmeria1> even\*  
15:09 <tmortagne> msmeria1: actually I was more expecting that you would tell me that you forgot to disabled wikistream :)  
15:09 <tmortagne> if the issue come from standard import it's a very serious issue  
15:09 <msmeria1> it seems it is by default unrelated to WikiStream  
15:10 <msmeria1> this is the first time I tested this feature (&history=true) otherwise I would've caught it sooner  
15:11 <tmortagne> yes it's not much tested since we don't want history in applications  
15:13 <tmortagne> msmeria1: I actually meant "Do" and not "So" in my comment  
15:15 <msmeria1> tmortagne: I got that :) either way my answer applies to it  
15:59 <msmeria1> has quit  
16:09 <kaisen> Hello, is there a way to get the XWiki as root page of my web Server. So that I don't need to add :8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome/ (:8080/xwiki) I tried the points under XWiki as root webapp from (http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationViaAPT) without success  
16:09 <kaisen> Maybe there is a other description?  
16:13 <lucaa> has quit  
16:14 <ClemensR> maybe this one helps: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ShortURLs  
16:33 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
16:48 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
16:48 <vmassol> yeah I'm back  
16:48 <vmassol> (didn't realize freenode was accessible again and my client must have timed out in its retries)  
16:58 <Danilo> has joined #xwiki  
16:59 <tmortagne> 2 issues left to reach XWIKI-10000 ;)  
17:00 <vmassol> what do we offer for the 10000 issue? :)  
17:01 <evalica> has quit  
17:13 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
17:15 <lucaa> has quit  
17:18 <vmassol> mflorea: shouldn't this go in 5.4.1? you think it's too dangerous?  
17:18 <sburjan> has quit  
17:19 <mflorea> 5.4.1 is a bug fixing release and  this is just a small improvement  
17:19 <mflorea> not dangerous, but still an improvement  
17:20 <mflorea> and a small one  
17:20 <vmassol> IMO it would still be good to have it since EM/DW is supposed to be "finished" in 5.x so it's a nice improvement. Unless you consider it too dangerous  
17:21 <vmassol> if you hadn't worked on it, I wouldn't have pushed it for 5.x though but you worked on it :)  
17:21 <vmassol> so we might as well bundle it in 5.4.1  
17:24 <mflorea> did we release 5.4?  
17:25 <vmassol> not yet  
17:25 <vmassol> tmortagne: what's the ETA now?  
17:26 <mflorea> so I can't merge it now  
17:26 <vmassol> depends on what tmortagne says, we were supposed to release today already  
17:27 <Denis> has quit  
17:36 <tmortagne> vmassol: there is still open issue for 5.4  
17:36 <tmortagne> issues  
17:37 <tmortagne> AFAIK gdelhumeau is almost done with XWIKI-9996  
17:37 <vmassol> this is not critical for 5.4 AFAIK  
17:37 <vmassol> it's only reporting errors  
17:37 <vmassol> do we have blockers?  
17:37 <vmassol> (I mean this one can be fixed easily in 5.4.1 IMO)  
17:37 <tmortagne> vmassol: having it telling you all is OK when the created failing does not sounds minor to me  
17:38 <vmassol> it's certianly not a blocker  
17:38 <tmortagne> and anyway as I saif gdelhumeau is pretty much done with it  
17:38 <ClemensR> maybe: XWIKI-9993  
17:38 <vmassol> we were supposed to release monday already  
17:38 <vmassol> and now it's more than 2 days late  
17:38 <ansuz> has quit  
17:39 <tmortagne> there is a lot of commits associated to XWIKI-9782, no idea what is its status  
17:39 <vmassol> AFAIK Denis says he's done and it's not used anyhwere anyways so not a blocker  
17:40 <tmortagne> I'm waiting for an answer from msmeria for XWIKI-9993 but he does not seems connected  
17:40 <gdelhumeau> do we have a generic translation key for the case when CRSF token is invalid?  
17:40 <tmortagne> vmassol: I don't really care it's not used, the issue is open and there is tons of associated commits  
17:40 <polx> has quit  
17:40 <vmassol> tmortagne: we can close it anytime, it's not a blocker  
17:41 <vmassol> regarding 9993 it should be easy to reproduce and if we cannot reproduce then we should leave it for 5.4.1  
17:55 <Sidali> has quit  
18:08 <ClemensR> has quit  
18:17 <tmortagne> mflorea: could you move the issue you are not going to do in 5.4  
18:18 <mflorea> tmortagne: sure  
18:26 <mflorea> has quit  
18:29 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
18:45 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
18:45 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
18:46 <Inge-> has quit  
18:49 <Inge-> has joined #xwiki  
18:54 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
19:22 <GuillaumeF> has quit  
19:25 <tmortagne> has quit  
19:28 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
19:45 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
19:59 <CapNemo> has joined #xwiki  
19:59 <CapNemo> hello  
20:05 <CapNemo> is there a way to retrieve the skin/theme used by xwiki site ?  
20:06 <gdelhumeau> CapNemo: it is http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Junco+Skin  
20:07 <gdelhumeau> good night  
20:07 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
20:11 <CapNemo> oh thanks :P)  
20:23 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
20:42 <Sidali> has joined #xwiki  
21:23 <ansuz> has joined #xwiki  
21:35 <CapNemo> that xwiki is really amazing to use :)  
21:40 <CapNemo> !search irc  
21:40 <CapNemo> oops ^^  
21:42 <Inge-> heh. it is the best wiki I've found  
21:43 <Inge-> But with the possiblity of offending all the good people working on it in here - I would really like to see a mean lean wiki without all the application bells and whistles :)  
21:46 <Guest82125> http://xwiki.475771.n2.nabble.com/Proposal-XWiki-6-x-Cycle-Theme-td7588564.html  
21:46 <Guest82125> I guess you're a bit in luck because that seems to be the rough consensus around the dev team  
21:47 <Guest82125> IE: that we need to concentrate on the core and make the applications really be applications (IE: optional extensions)  
21:47 <Guest82125> is now known as <\_\_cjd\_\_>  
21:50 <Inge-> I like what those who broke off from Wordpress have done with Ghost  
21:50 <Inge-> but that might be a little radical  
21:56 <Sidali> has quit  
21:58 <\_\_cjd\_\_> has quit  
21:59 <\_\_cjd\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
21:59 <\_\_cjd\_\_> hm sasl auth is dead  
22:00 <CapNemo> Inge-: yes I hear you on that, even if I love the extension system  
22:07 <Inge-> well, I am absolutely stronglyu in favor of an extension system  
22:07 <Inge-> there just seems to be a pretty clear niche for a great light wiki that works extremely well as a wiki primarily  
22:08 <vmassol> Inge-: yes we also agree with you about the lean wiki. As mentioned it's the goal of 6.x to not add too many features and work on improving what's there  
22:09 <vmassol> btw we didn't add a lot of features in 5.x either, we also focused on improving existing stuff, except for the DW/EM which is the plan to make xwiki even more slim and mean  
22:11 <Inge-> mmm right  
22:11 <vmassol> DW/EM is a big piece  
22:11 <vmassol> a complex piece  
22:12 <vmassol> which still require work to be perfect  
22:12 <vmassol> not a lot of software are doing the extension mechanism right (look at eclipse which is far from perfect and require restarts ;))  
22:12 <Inge-> hehe  
22:12 <vmassol> and in our case it's much more complex than Eclipse  
22:13 <vmassol> since users can change the extensions code (equivalent of eclipse plugins)  
22:13 <vmassol> (so we need to merge)  
22:13 <CapNemo> ouch, I managed to create a page with the name carrying ${channel} and I can't delete it :-/  
22:13 <vmassol> :)  
22:13 <vmassol> you can do this:  
22:15 <vmassol> use a velcoity script to use $xwiki.getXWiki().deleteDocument()  
22:15 <vmassol> was trying to find a snippet on e.x.o  
22:15 <vmassol> cannot find it although I was sure we had one  
22:17 <vmassol> $xwiki.getXWiki().deleteDocument($doc.getDocument(), false,  $context.context)  
22:17 <vmassol> (CapNemo)  
22:17 <vmassol> you'll need PR though  
22:17 <CapNemo> mmm I see what you mean  
22:17 <vmassol> (the false means to not go in the trash)  
22:17 <CapNemo> and how do you get $doc here ?  
22:18 <vmassol> $xwiki.getDocument("....")  
22:18 <vmassol> actually  
22:18 <vmassol> $xwiki.getDocument("….").getDocument() to get an XWikiDocument  
22:19 <CapNemo> ah I see  
22:19 <CapNemo> nice :)  
22:22 <vmassol> CapNemo: here's the simplest form  
22:22 <vmassol> $xwiki.getDocument("…").delete()  
22:24 <vmassol> let me try your use case though, it's not normal that it doens't work OOB  
22:25 <vmassol> CapNemo: what's your page URL?  
22:25 <vmassol> I have: http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/%24%7Bchannel%7D  
22:25 <benoitc> has joined #xwiki  
22:25 <vmassol> and I can delete that  
22:25 <benoitc> hi  
22:25 <vmassol> hi  
22:25 <benoitc> is there a way to delete old logs from the irc bot ?  
22:26 <CapNemo> eheh I was asking just that  
22:26 <CapNemo> specially the ${channel} one  
22:26 <vmassol> benoitc: you're using the irc bot locally?  
22:26 <vmassol> deleteing logs should be as easy as deleting the page  
22:26 <vmassol> there's one page per day of log  
22:26 <benoitc> capame has  a local access on the machine  
22:27 <vmassol> CapNemo: please give me the URL  
22:27 <vmassol> so that I can reproduce  
22:27 <CapNemo> ok I remove the pages  
22:27 <CapNemo> except the ${channel} based one  
22:27 <vmassol> CapNemo: can you paste here the URL here?  
22:27 <benoitc> http://wiki.refuge.io/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/WebHome  
22:27 <CapNemo> http://wiki.refuge.io/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/WebHome  
22:27 <benoitc> vmassol:  
22:28 <CapNemo> oops  
22:28 <benoitc> heh  
22:28 <vmassol> CapNemo: no ${channel} in the URL  
22:28 <vmassol> I don't understans what you guys are talking about sorry :)  
22:28 <CapNemo> there is a link in this page towards the page "${channel}Archive20140204"  
22:28 <vmassol> what's the URL of the page you're trying to delete?  
22:28 <CapNemo> http://wiki.refuge.io/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/%24%7Bchannel%7DArchive20140204  
22:29 <vmassol> ok that's better  
22:29 <vmassol> I cannot reproduce, works fine here  
22:29 <CapNemo> sorry about that :)  
22:29 <vmassol> what version of xwiki are you using?  
22:29 <CapNemo> I believe 5.3  
22:29 <vmassol> that seems recent enough  
22:29 <vmassol> I'm on 5.4RC1  
22:29 <vmassol> but I don't remember any change in this area since 5.3  
22:30 <CapNemo> perhaps it was a bug in the bot itself creating a badly named page  
22:30 <vmassol> so my page is http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/%24%7Bchannel%7DArchive20140204  
22:30 <vmassol> which is exactly what yiou have  
22:30 <Denis> has quit  
22:31 <vmassol> no  
22:31 <vmassol> it's the standard xwiki delete feature  
22:31 <CapNemo> looks this way yes  
22:31 <vmassol> you're using the menu to delete it right?  
22:31 <vmassol> and then Delete  
22:31 <vmassol> ?  
22:31 <CapNemo> I was just trying to reach the page itself  
22:32 <CapNemo> if I go to the space document index and try to delete the page, I get a similar error  
22:33 <kaisen> has quit  
22:33 <CapNemo> I can see this in the log:  
22:33 <CapNemo> Caused by: java.net.URISyntaxException: Illegal character in path at index 44: http://localhost:8180/xwiki/bin/delete/IRC/${channel}Archive20140204  
22:34 <vmassol> ah  
22:34 <vmassol> this is fixed in 5.4 actually  
22:34 <vmassol> :)  
22:34 <vmassol> I remember fixing this  
22:34 <vmassol> (I think)  
22:35 <CapNemo> eheh :)  
22:35 <CapNemo> double enconding the url  
22:35 <CapNemo> or alike  
22:36 <CapNemo> btw, where are the pages stored exactly?  
22:36 <vmassol> in a DB  
22:37 <vmassol> you're using the standalone version of xwiki?  
22:37 <CapNemo> using the war deployed in tomcat + mysql  
22:37 <vmassol> if so, it's in HSQLDB in XWIKIHOME/data/database/  
22:37 <vmassol> ah  
22:37 <vmassol> then in mysql :)  
22:37 <CapNemo> eheh :)  
22:37 <vmassol> tables are http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/DatabaseSchema  
22:38 <CapNemo> oh about that, I really love the documentation around xwiki, it's really precise and accurate  
22:38 <vmassol> really? hey that's nice to hear :)  
22:39 <CapNemo> yes it's really refreshing. I've working with stuff like alfresco and liferay and xwiki is far far away for the documentation  
22:39 <benoitc> how do you create the home of the xwiki page?  
22:39 <vmassol> hehe nice :)  
22:40 <vmassol> benoitc: you mean http://xwiki.org?  
22:40 <benoitc> yup  
22:40 <CapNemo> benoitc: add ?viewer=code to see how it's done :)  
22:40 <vmassol> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome?viewer=code  
22:40 <vmassol> :)  
22:40 <benoitc> k  
22:40 <benoitc> thanks  
22:42 <Inge-> CapNemo: not to mention that you will also get help on here if you get stuck.  
22:42 <Inge-> at least until we completely overwhelm them :)  
22:43 <vmassol> :)  
22:43 <vmassol> that would be our fault if it happens  
22:44 <vmassol> meaning xwiki is not easy enough to use… now since you can do pretty wild things with it, it can always happen  
22:45 <CapNemo> yep :)  
22:46 <vmassol> sorry guys, got to go to bed now  
22:47 <vmassol> I'll be here tomorrow if you need help  
22:47 <vmassol> bfn  
22:47 <CapNemo> have a good night and thanks  
22:47 <vmassol> you too, bye  
22:47 <vmassol> has quit  
23:17 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki
